info.title: VedaCore Signals API
info.description: High-precision KP ephemeris calculations for trading signals

post.description:
Calculate basic Vedic chart with planets, houses, and essential points.

Returns planet positions, house cusps with lords, ascendant and MC.
All calculations use sidereal zodiac with specified ayanamsha.

Analyze transits within specified time window.

Returns significant transit events, aspects, and overall window scoring
for timing decisions.

Calculate divisional chart (Varga) for specified division.

Supports standard Varga divisions: d9 (navamsa), d10 (dasamsa), 
d60 (shashtyamsa), etc.

Calculate Panchanga (five limbs) for given time and place.

Returns Tithi, Vara, Nakshatra, Yoga, Karana and timing windows.

Calculate complete KP chart with cusps, sub-lords, and significators.

Returns KP house cusps with sub-lords, planet positions with 
Nakshatra/Pada, and house significators if requested.

Calculate KP chain (Nakshatra Lord → Sub Lord → Sub-Sub Lord) for target.

Accepts planet or cusp as target and returns complete chain analysis
with degrees, Nakshatra/Pada information, and house context.

Calculate KP Ruling Planets for given time and place.

Returns time-based ruling planets following traditional KP methods
with day lord analysis if requested.

Calculate KP Horary chart using number (1-249) or datetime mode.

Traditional KP horary analysis for Prashna (questions).
Supports both number-based and time-based horary methods.

Calculate KP transit events within specified window.

Returns significant transits affecting KP significators
with applying/separating aspects and timing analysis.

get.description:
Get list of supported Ayanamsha systems.

Returns available ayanamsha calculations with descriptions
and supported calculation types.

Get list of supported Varga (divisional chart) types.

Returns standard Varga divisions with descriptions and usage guidance.

Get list of supported aspect calculation modes.

Returns available aspect systems with orbs and supported calculations.

post.description:
Resolve location query to coordinates and timezone.

Searches cities, regions, and landmarks to provide accurate
coordinates and IANA timezone identifiers for Vedic calculations.

get.description:
Search for cities matching query string.

Fast city lookup for autocomplete and selection interfaces.
Returns cities with coordinates and timezone information.

post.description:
Issue one-time streaming token for SSE/WebSocket authentication.

Creates JWT token with:
- Topic-scoped access (only specified topic allowed)
- Short TTL (≤ 300 seconds, default 180)
- Single-use enforcement via jti
- Proper audience claim for stream validation

get.description:
Validate current authentication token.

Returns token information and validity status.
Useful for client token health checks.

Subscribe to Server-Sent Events stream for specified topic.

Requires one-time streaming token issued via /api/v1/auth/stream-token.
Token must be topic-scoped and will be consumed on first use.

Get list of available streaming topics.

Returns discoverable topics with descriptions and access requirements.

Kubernetes liveness probe endpoint.

Returns 200 OK if the application process is alive and responsive.
This should only fail if the process is completely dead.

Ultra‑simple plaintext liveness for external monitors.

Always returns HTTP 200 with body "ok" when the process is responsive.

Kubernetes readiness probe endpoint.

Returns 200 OK if all critical dependencies are functional.
Returns 503 Service Unavailable if any critical systems are failing.

This endpoint validates:
- KP calculation engine functionality
- Cache storage accessibility
- Authentication system configuration
- System adapter registry

Get current metrics snapshot for monitoring.

Returns internal metrics and performance indicators.

Get version and environment information.

Useful for deployment verification and debugging.

Comprehensive startup health check.

This endpoint runs detailed validation of all system components
and should be called after deployment to verify everything is working.
More comprehensive than /ready endpoint.

post.description:
Get intraday KP lord signals for a given date

Returns time slices with:
- NL/SL/SL2 lords for each interval
- AMD phase detection relative to changes
- Nearest change references
- Trading session information

get.description:
Health check for enhanced signals service.

Returns service status and key metrics without authentication.

post.description:
Enhanced KP timing signals with multi-timeframe analysis and confluence detection.

Features:
- Multi-timeframe analysis across 1m, 5m, 15m, 1h, 4h, 1d intervals
- Redis-backed caching for sub-millisecond retrieval
- Confluence detection across multiple planetary transits
- Performance metrics and monitoring

Performance targets:
- Cache hit: <10ms P95
- Cache miss: <150ms P95
- Redis failover: <300ms P95

get.description:
Real-time streaming of enhanced KP timing signals via Server-Sent Events.

Stream topics:
- Enhanced signals as they are detected
- Confluence alerts when multiple signals align
- Performance and health updates

Browser compatible with automatic reconnection support.

Get performance statistics for the enhanced signals service.

Includes:
- Request/response metrics
- Cache performance
- Redis availability
- Service health indicators

post.description:
Manually invalidate signal cache for a specific date/planet.

Useful for:
- Forcing recalculation after astronomical data updates
- Cache corruption recovery
- Testing and development

get.description: GET endpoint for location features (single lat/lon or server-mapped cities).

parameters.name: city_query

schema.description: Free-text city query resolved via atlas
schema.title: City Query

parameters.description: Free-text city query resolved via atlas

post.description: POST endpoint for location features (explicit coordinates list).

Calculate current Vimshottari Dasha periods.

Returns active dasha chain at specified levels:
- Level 1: Mahadasha only
- Level 2: Mahadasha + Antardasha
- Level 3: + Pratyantardasha
- Level 4: + Sookshma
- Level 5: + Prana

Get all dasha transitions occurring on a specific date.

Returns list of change events with:
- level: Which dasha level changed
- type: 'start' or 'end'
- planet: Planet involved
- timestamp: Exact time of change

Get full 120-year Vimshottari cycle with nested periods.

Returns hierarchical structure with all dasha periods.
Warning: Response can be large with higher level values.

Get birth balance dasha information.

Returns:
- Birth nakshatra and lord
- Elapsed and remaining days in birth dasha
- Elapsed and remaining portions

get.description: List available dasha systems and their capabilities.

post.description:
Get node events (stationary, direction changes) in a time range.

Returns list of events with:
- type: Event type (stationary_start, stationary_end, direction_change, wobble_peak)
- timestamp: Exact time of event
- speed: Node speed at event time
- Additional metadata based on event type

get.description:
Get current node state (position, speed, direction, stationary flag).

This endpoint provides live calculation with minimal caching (5s TTL).

Find the next node event of a specific type.

Event types:
- stationary_start: Node entering stationary phase
- stationary_end: Node exiting stationary phase
- direction_change: Node changing direction (retro/direct)
- wobble_peak: Local speed extrema (if enabled)

post.description:
Get statistical analysis of node behavior over a period.

Returns:
- Event counts by type
- Speed statistics (min, max, average)
- Configuration used

get.description:
Get current node detection configuration.

Shows thresholds, feature flags, and cache settings.
List available node systems and their capabilities.

post.description:
Find eclipses within a date range

Returns solar and/or lunar eclipses between start and end dates.
Maximum range is 5 years.

Check local visibility of an eclipse

Determines if an eclipse is visible from a specific location
and provides visibility details.

Get the path of a solar eclipse

Returns the central line and limits of a solar eclipse.
Only applicable for total, annular, and hybrid eclipses.

Find the next eclipse after a given time

Searches for the next eclipse of the specified type and classification.

get.description: Get current eclipse configuration

post.description:
Get moon profile with Phase 7 indices

Returns velocity index, latitude index, distance index,
and overall strength assessment.

Find moon anomaly events in date range

Returns perigee, apogee, and standstill events.

get.description:
Get panchanga elements for a specific time

Returns tithi, nakshatra, yoga, karana, and paksha.

Get moon strength assessment

Returns strength indices and anomaly flags.
Get current moon configuration

post.summary: Get volatility windows for a day
post.description:
Generate volatility windows for a single day.

Returns a timeline of micro-volatility windows with scores and factors.

post.summary: Get volatility windows for date range
post.description:
Generate volatility windows for a date range.

Returns merged timeline across multiple days.

get.description:
Find the next upcoming volatility window meeting the threshold.

Searches up to max_days_range (default 31) days ahead.

post.description:
Calculate volatility score at a specific timestamp.

Returns score, strength, and active contributing factors.

get.description:
Get current micro-timing configuration and metadata.

Returns weights, thresholds, window sizes, and feature flags.

post.description:
Generate minute-by-minute confidence timeline for a trading day.

Returns confidence scores, direction hints, and applied rules for each minute.

Get aggregated confidence statistics for a time window.

Useful for analyzing specific market periods or sessions.

get.description: Get current strategy configuration including weights, rules, and thresholds.

post.description:
Test a strategy configuration without persisting it.

Useful for experimenting with different weights and rules.

get.description: Check health of strategy system and dependencies.

post.description:
Get all enabled advisory calculations for a specific moment.

Returns advisory layers based on enabled feature flags.
Only modules with enabled flags will be included in the response.

post.summary: Get advisory data for time range
post.description:
Get advisory snapshots over a time range.

Samples advisory data at regular intervals across the specified range.
Useful for identifying patterns and timing windows.

get.description:
Get current status of advisory feature flags.

Shows which advisory modules are enabled, available, and their configuration.

post.description:
Calculate KP Ruling Planets for a given moment.

Returns the ruling planets based on:
- Ascendant sign, star, and sub lords
- Moon sign, star, and sub lords
- Day lord (Vara)
- Hora lord (planetary hour)

Requires ENABLE_KP_RULING_PLANETS feature flag.

Calculate six-fold planetary strength (Shadbala).

Returns strength components:
- Sthana Bala (positional)
- Dig Bala (directional)
- Kala Bala (temporal)
- Chesta Bala (motional)
- Naisargika Bala (natural)
- Drik Bala (aspectual)

Requires ENABLE_SHADBALA feature flag.

get.description: Check advisory service health and configuration.

post.description:
Calculate personal Tara Bala based on birth Moon.

Returns the 9-fold Tara position and quality assessment
for timing decisions based on nakshatra relationships.

Evaluate muhurta quality for multiple participants.

Useful for selecting event timing that works for
multiple people based on their birth Moons.

Scan Tara quality throughout a day.

Returns hourly or summary assessment of Tara positions
to identify favorable and unfavorable windows.

Calculate universal Tara based on current Moon nakshatra.

Provides general timing quality without personal birth data.
Uses day's starting nakshatra as reference.

get.description:
Get information about all 9 Tara types.

Returns descriptions and quality indicators for each Tara.

Get help information about Tara Bala system.

Explains the 9-fold cycle and how to use it for timing.

post.description:
Calculate Arabic Parts/Fortuna Points.

Returns positions and interpretations for requested points.
Includes Part of Fortune, Spirit, Love, Marriage, Career, etc.

Calculate Part of Fortune with detailed analysis.

The most important Arabic Part, representing worldly success
and the integration of solar and lunar energies.

Track movement of fortuna points throughout a day.

Shows how Arabic Parts move through houses and signs,
useful for intraday timing.

Get fortuna point positions over a time range.

Useful for identifying when a point enters specific houses or signs.

get.description:
List all available Fortuna Points/Arabic Parts.

Returns names, formulas, and interpretations.

Get help information about Fortuna Points system.

Explains Arabic Parts and their usage in astrology.

post.description:
Detect transit events at given timestamp.

Main endpoint for transit event detection using the
Moon-centric KP chain triggering system.

Get Moon triggers for specific planets.

Check how Moon's current KP chain triggers specific planets
through gates and resonances.

get.description:
Get current gate values for all planets.

Returns the Moon→Planet connectivity strength for inspection.

post.description:
Check birth chart promise for themes.

Validates whether planets promise specific themes based on
their natal positions and significator relationships.

get.description: Get current transit event configuration and feature flags.
Health check for transit event system.

post.description:
Calculate ATS transit scores for given timestamp

Returns normalized scores (0-100) for target planets based on
aspect-transfer energy from all planets.

Performance: <10ms cached, <50ms cold

Calculate ATS scores for a time range

Returns list of score calculations at specified intervals.
Maximum range: 24 hours.

get.description:
Get current ATS configuration

Returns context file, default targets, and other metadata.

Validate ATS scores for correctness

Checks score ranges, computation time, and other constraints.

parameters.name: timestamp

schema.description: UTC timestamp to validate (defaults to current time)
schema.title: Timestamp

parameters.description: UTC timestamp to validate (defaults to current time)

get.description:
Get ATS system status

Returns health check and basic system information.
Check ATS service health (deprecated - use /status)
List available ATS contexts

post.description:
Calculate Panchanga using SystemAdapter registry pattern

This demonstrates the PM-requested approach:
- Uses registry.get("panchanga") instead of direct imports
- Logs include adapter_id + adapter_version
- No direct imports from modules/panchanga/*

get.description: Check Panchanga adapter health via registry
Get Panchanga adapter input/output schema

post.description: Get explanation of Panchanga results via registry

Calculate KP Horary number (1-249) for a given timestamp.

Supports three calculation modes:
- unix_mod: Direct modulo of Unix timestamp
- daily_mod: Seconds since local midnight
- sunrise_mod: Seconds since sunrise (traditional KP method)

Returns horary number with planetary ruler and Moon boost factor.

get.description: Health check for Horary service

post.description:
Compute KP Ruling Planets for a given moment.

Calculates the planetary rulers at any moment based on:
- Day lord (weekday ruler)
- Ascendant sign lord, nakshatra lord, sub lord
- Moon sign lord, nakshatra lord, sub lord
- Fortification bonuses for exalted/own sign planets

Returns ranked list with stable ordering and total strength score.

get.description:
Get information about a specific weekday.

Args:
    weekday_idx: 0=Monday, 1=Tuesday, ..., 6=Sunday
Get API schema for Ruling Planets endpoints
Get explanation of Ruling Planets calculation logic
Health check for Ruling Planets service

SSE endpoint for real-time topic streaming.

CRITICAL: Uses query parameter authentication because EventSource API
cannot send Authorization headers in browsers.

Usage: GET /stream/kp.v1.moon.chain?token=jwt_token_here

Get streaming statistics for debugging and monitoring.

CRITICAL: This is a plain JSON endpoint, NOT a stream.
Requires authentication but accessible to all tenants.

post.description:
DEV ONLY: Publish a test message to a topic.

CRITICAL: This endpoint is gated by STREAM_DEV_PUBLISH_TOKEN and
disabled in production via STREAM_DEV_PUBLISH_ENABLED=false.

Usage: POST /_dev_publish/kp.v1.moon.chain?token=dev_secret
Body: {"degree": 123.45, "speed": 13.06, ...}

JWT-protected publish endpoint for production streaming.

CRITICAL: Requires 'stream:publish' scope and topic ACL validation.
This replaces dev-publish for production use with proper auth.

Usage: POST /stream/publish/kp.v1.moon.chain?token=jwt_with_publish_scope
Body: {"degree": 123.45, "speed": 13.06, ...}

get.description:
Health check endpoint for streaming service.

No authentication required for health checks.

WebSocket service health check.

No authentication required for health checks.

Detailed WebSocket statistics for monitoring.

No authentication required for monitoring endpoints.

SSE stream that periodically fetches the Location Features payload.

Contract is intentionally thin: it forwards to the existing /api/v1/location/features
so the single source of truth for computation remains the features endpoint.

Security: forwards the caller's Authorization header, if any.
Versioning: propagates X-VedaCore-Version from the inner call into event payload headers.

schema.description: ISO8601 UTC start timestamp; defaults to 'now' UTC
schema.title: Timestamp

schema.description: Optional max number of feature events to send (for testing)

parameters.description: Optional max number of feature events to send (for testing)

schema.description: Short-lived JWT token for browser EventSource (alternative to Authorization header)
schema.title: Token
